intro: Nauclea africana, commonly known as the African nauclea, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits. Nauclea africana is often found in moist, lowland areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in the ecosystems of its native range.
